Subject: File system folders/files without BUILTINAdministrators permissions
Description: Our file system should have permissions for BUILTINAdministrators by default for all shares/folders/files.  What would be the easiest way to identify where these permissions are missing?  I don't believe an out of the box report provides that info, so I can either create a report or run a SQL query to get the info.  However I'm having difficulty determining which tables or views to use.
Solution_Comment__c:
Issue

What would be the easiest way to identify where these permissions are missing?

Resolution

Answered questions revolving around optimal ways to track permission changes as well as monitor when permission changes took place. Determined that multiple reports would need to be created to target the different change types for email automation. I suggested using the NAM console to get a more reactionary result of the permission changes.
